title: Always a pleasure
body: have a neurological disorder - under good control however always able to support me when it flares. The surgery does a great job in my opinion and I am grateful for them, and the NHS! We wouldn't half be in a pickle without them

author: Patgn96
title: Trying for an appointment for over a month
body:
My experiences with this practice have gone downhill, even more so since my GP left. Management have been less than useless - refusing to respond to emails and calls - avoiding speaking to me as a patient like I'm the plague, thereby exacerbating the issues.  
The Practice have ceased pre-bookable appts completely (I’ve been trying for over a month) and have said the only way to book an appt is to ring at 8am - even if my issue isn’t urgent. Imagine asking +10k patients all ring at 8am - not all of us have that luxury of being able to ring then as we have work!

readBy.name: Healthwatch Oldham
Kapur Family Care

author: moonqg44
title: Covid booster vaccination
body: I went to get my Covid booster vaccination yesterday & despite having an appointment, I had to queue and wait an hour to get it. I don't understand why so many appointments were made at one time. When I got the first 2 doses at the local hospital I did not have to wait. I was worried I would have a parking ticket having only parked/paid for an hour & was also desperate for the toilet but there was nowhere to go.

readBy.name: NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Big Thanks
title: Good problem solving intervention
body:
Over two days, I made approximately 15 attempts to contact Ward 210 where I knew my 95yr old mother had been transferred to in end of life circumstances. Each time I called the phone was either engaged or ringing out with no-one answering. Eventually, when someone did answer, I was surprised to be told my mother had been transferred to Ward 81 without anyone letting me know. I was disappointed and frustrated with my inability to communicate with Ward 210, which exacerbated my stress levels at such a critical time. I rang Ward 81 in fear of similar contact problems, but was pleased that Alison answered the call promptly, which was a great relief. Alison immediately recognised my anxieties. She allayed my concerns regarding my mother's deteriorating situation and empathised regarding the communication difficulties I had experienced. Alison's caring professionalism retrieved the situation. The exemplary way in which she explained my mother's care plan, and identified proposals to overcome the hurdles delaying my mother's return to the nursing home for end of life care, were very reassuring. Alison's excellent communication skills involved genuine compassion. Immediately she identified clear actions that she proposed to take, which gave me confidence that she had a commitment to complete them. Over the following hours she delivered on those commitments. Alison's outstanding professionalism prompts me to draw the attention of management to an exceptional member of staff going above and beyond the call of duty.  
I'm sure my frustrations with Ward 210 were born out of being over stretched and staff focussing on patient priorities, relative contact having by necessity to take second place, which I understand.  
I wish to place on Alison's record my sincere appreciation for a job well done. Thank you Alison.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: BatemoorPatient
title: Changes to how we receive healthcare
body:
The challenges created by the new paradigm shift of coronavirus has imposed significant changes on how we receive health care. To reduce the risk of spreading coronavirus, by person to person consultations, access to the Meadowgreen practice at Jordanthorpe has changed. Using technology enables a wide range of services to be delivered with the "ether" providing a barrier against coronavirus.  
Learning how to best use the new access methods has been challenging. Learning how to sing, listening to on hold music, has become the norm. Translating my impatience into a positive benefit, I can sing. As soon as I get to speak to the reception staff, receive a call from the medical staff, I find the ambiance very friendly and professional. Any anxiety or concerns are resolved creating a better outcome.  
Thank you to:  
The practice Receptionists, very friendly and professional providing calming reassurance.  
Practice Physicians Associates, listening, questioning and diagnosing effectively. Recent advice was life saving, without it my health might have declined dangerously.  
Practice nurses, often exposing themselves to high risks by face to face contact with patients, superb, pain free, blood extractors!  
Practice Doctors, I feel they take the time and effort to listen, considering my thoughts in diagnosing issues.  
In all, the practice goes above and beyond. Every member of the team I've encountered at Jordanthorpe Health Centre offers rare patient care, not often heard nowadays. The anxiety and new way of working with the team removes significant issues, encountered by the majority of patients in todays challenging times.  
Thank you, each and everyone of the practice team are improving the health of the local community.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice
Healthwatch Sheffield

author: out of touch
title: Audiology clinic
body: I recently phoned audiology as I was having feed back on my hearing aid. Which was frequent and annoying. I have had a hearing aid for a number of years and never experienced any problems in the past. I asked if it was possible to have an appointment with audiology clinic. The member of staff I spoke to told me you will experience this with hearing aids. I duly said so I just have to put up with this and they said yes. End of conversation. I was not happy with the outcome. I went online and looked up feedback on hearing aids. I did get a few explanations which were very helpful. One being there could be a problem with the dome, I also remembered I had put in a new dome, luckily enough I had a spare and changed the said dome. What a difference. Problem solved. I was left feeling let down after the phone call. Before covid, I had no problems attending ear clinics to get dome and hearing aids checked. The staff at Wishaw are very helpful as are Stonehouse and Hairmyres. I unfortunately can't have a hearing aid in my right ear due to having a Mastoid operation when I was younger. I really depend on my hearing aid and feel I am not getting the proper service due to communication with the person at Hamilton Clinic not being very helpful.

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire

author: Lwhgiffnock
title: Flu and Covid vaccination
body:
I accompanied a friend to receive covid and flu booster vaccine. The staff were helpful and a joy to talk to. Can I ask though that some consideration be given to the timing of appointments in the winter? My friend was anxious not to be going home in the dark but received an appointment time for the evening. We went early as could not get through on the phone number to ask for an earlier time. Thankfully she was seen straight away but realise we may not have been fortunate and there was an element of luck.  
The staff were superb in accommodating and I am extremely grateful to all of them.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership
NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

title: Excellent practice
body:
I hope you are all managing ok under the immense current pressures. Can I just say that generally, the care I receive from the Tardis Surgery is second to none. The reception team, GPs and support staff are just fabulous. Always helpful, professional, polite and friendly (despite I am sure coming under fire from patients on a regular basis).  I am triaged appropriately and given the correct appointment for my needs. Whether that be a GP telephone or face to face appointment,  an appointment with the nurse, or indeed, when no appointment available, I have been given an appointment with the extended hours service.

I know you are still under an inordinate amount of pressure on your time and services, but just wanted to pass on my heartfelt thanks for all that you guys do.  It's not an easy job to be doing at the moment, I'm sure.

title: New patient
body:
Have recently switched to this practice after  recommendations from family and friends and months of issues with access to appointments elsewhere - so far so good .

 A helpful , efficient , friendly & responsive Practice.

author: Seoras65
title: The very best care at all times
body:
Following my recent bowel screening, I unfortunately had to have a routine colonoscopy. The most obvious reaction to being told that the screening had identified a potential issue, is to automatically assume the very worst, which I did, and I was preparing myself as best I could for bad news.  
My agony about the unknown was prolonged as I was unlucky in that I contracted COVID just before I was due to have my original planned procedure. The obvious impact being to my mental health, due to the extended period of worry, but extending to those around me both family and friends who were sharing this with me. I am extremely grateful to the team who looked after me during my procedure. Diane, Jackie, Roseann and Jessica were fantastic, from explaining exactly what they would be doing during the procedure, to reassuring me throughout, keeping me calm and relaxed. They chatted to me about what may seem the most everyday of things, whilst providing the very best care at all times. The procedure was over before I knew it and I am very relieved and pleased to say I received a clean bill of health. Our NHS and those individuals who look after us at every part of the process, whatever it may be, are exemplary to say the very least. We have the most amazing and dedicated people who go above and beyond for those in their care every day, and in particular at the most difficult of times. I can't thank these four wonderful people enough for looking after me.  
To everyone in our wonderful NHS I would say that we have referred to you as being "Hero's" for almost two years now because of the amazing dedication you have shown to everyone during the recent pandemic, but truly you are Hero's every day in life for just being there for people like me.  
A massive thank you from me, for everything.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
NHS Education for Scotland

author: empathymn78
title: The nurse was fantastic
body:
I attend Glenboig surgery for a long over due smear test. The nurse undertaking the smear was fantastic and patient. She took the time to make me feel at ease and talked me through the whole process. During the exam she really helped me relax more and what is usually quite a traumatic experience for me was over and done so quick.  
I wish I'd got the nurses name. She is a credit to her profession.

readBy.name: Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
NHS Lanarkshire
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Partnership for Change

author: rhinohg64
title: A very pleasant and helpful visit
body: I had a visit today from Jenny from community mental health. I found everything about her visit very pleasant, and she was very helpful/ She'll be coming to visit me again next month.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran
Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
NHS Education for Scotland

author: Charlotte1992
title: The staff were amazing
body: My family and I where away on holiday when our 4 month old daughter became unwell. I visited the Urgent Care Unit Centre in Bridlington we was reviewed extremely quickly all the staff we came into contact with were caring and compassionate. It was felt my little girl needed be reviewed further and we was asked to go to, the Duke of Kent ward at Scarborough hospital. Again, the staff were amazing , doctors , nurses and health care assistants were amazing. I very rarely provide feedback but the way they dealt with my little girl was first class. I work for the NHS also but I could see from the way the staff worked together they thoroughly enjoyed being there. The interactions they had with each other making sure everyone's needs had been met. All of the treatment provided was explained to me and I was able to leave a few hours later with the correct treatment and medication. I am unsure of all the staffs names who I dealt with however I will be forever grateful.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Tr5cy
title: My experience of CAMHS as a parent
body:
Just over 3 years ago my teenage daughter made a desperate attempt on her life and as a result ended up in hospital. She was visited by the Crisis Team and did not connect with them at all. As a parent I was extremely distressed by the whole event and couldn't understand what my daughter was experiencing. We tried private counselling - that didn't work. We tried the school - that didn't work and her cry for help was just getting louder by the day.  
A referral had been made to CAMHS and it was a struggle to get her to even get into the car to attend the appointment. A further struggle to get her to go into the room and meet the Dr. However, she did and we were very lucky to be met by Dr Clarke. Dr Clarke took his time and carefully and patiently explained to my daughter why she was feeling the way she was. This did not happen overnight and he was always very patient and understanding. When she did want to start communicating he listened and involved me in the discussions. All appointments were made in full consultation with my daughter and I. He explained coping strategies that she understood and started apply. Thankfully, due to his caring and understanding nature we are through the worst part of this episode. My daughter has started looking to her future and made plans - she knows how to apply coping strategies, when needed and has a better understanding of why she felt the way she did.  
I wanted to share this to let other parents know that there is help and also to let the CAMHS service know they are doing a great job.. Thank U.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: J's Daughter
title: Our brave mum & her brilliant team in Ward B5
body:
Our mum arrived at Ward B5 (Beatson) to start her radiotherapy in August, she was terrified. Not because of her diagnosis, or her impending treatment- as she had been there before (over 30 years ago, but she remembered it well).  
What was really scaring her was the way she had been treated in another hospital recently, and being a fiercely independent lady of 82 she didn't like to have to depend on anyone - but having also suffered a stroke she needed to be supported. As her youngest daughter I was also really reluctant to leave her in the care of the team in B5, and sought reassurance several times before leaving her that 1st day.  
What I want to feedback is mum could not have been in better hands! She was so well looked after - which we knew within her very 1st day- that it was 1 less thing to worry about.  
We cannot thank Ward B5 in Beatson enough for their dedication and care of our mum. Every single team member were absolute professionals in every aspect of their work.  
Thank you to all the people who work in Ward B5, providing the vest best of care and attention to some of the most vulnerable people in need of support. You should all be very proud.

readBy.name: Scottish Government
NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: tucanaty99
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very positive experience
body: I had a very positive experience in hospital. The ward is always spotless-it's very clean which I really appreciate. The staff are fantastic. They are so friendly and they always see when you need them and they come really quickly. Their communication is very good and they always introduce themselves. I felt very safe in hospital and the only minor issue was that A+E was very busy but I don't know how that could be improved. I had a great care experience and I couldn't fault anything the staff did.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: charakx98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nothing but good
body:
I have nothing but good things to say - if you ring the bell staff will be with you right away. Moreover the staff explain things really well.  
The tests come through really quick, I was told there was a long waiting list however I was taken for tests within 2 days and I was really happy about that as I thought I'd be waiting weeks.  
It is really good to have a visitor every 2 days and it is great visiting is allowed as it is very lonely without them.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Hospital919
title: Very helpful staff
body:
My mum had an appointment at the Aberdeen Royal Infirmary A&E due to a blood clot in her leg.  
The staff were very nice indeed and very helpful. She would like to express her gratitude to them all.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
NHS Grampian

author: Sunshine67
title: Delivered with a smile
body: I fell at the end of the summer, and twisted my ankle alongside a fractured fibula. The treatment and support I received from Bodmin MIU; Bodmin XRay department and the RCHT fracture clinic delivered at Bodmin OPD was fantastic. Over a 6 week period I received everything I needed, never had to wait, and the service was always delivered with a smile! Thank you all!

readBy.name: Cornwall Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: JennyPearl
title: Breast feeding support
body:
I was looked after post C-section in the Ulster Hospital maternity ward following the birth of my first daughter for 2 nights. She was quite sleepy and snuffly following the C-section and it was challenging getting breast feeding established. I had wonderful support from the staff in the ward day and night including midwifes and auxiliaries who were on hand to offer support and advice. One particular midwife called Cora helped me on the day shift on our second day in hospital. She took lots of time to show me different positions to try and support feeding and came back to check on us a number of times. Her manner was encouraging and supportive at a time that can feel exhausting and overwhelming and it made a big difference to our breast feeding journey.  
A big thank you to the whole team at the Ulster Hospital Maternity unit but especially Cora for going that extra mile.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Patient and Client Council
Public Health Agency
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: monocerosth86
title: Put my mind at rest
body:
I walked into a bannister with my breast, which became very painful a few days later.  
Doctor Rauf examined me and put my mind to rest and reassured me on what happened and why I was feeling so much pain.  
It was lovely seeing her again after so long! And I left the surgery with a much lighter note.

readBy.name: The Lawson Practice
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
City & Hackney GP Confederation

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A great team
body: They are a great team!!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: deploymentsm78
title: The experience has been OK
body: The experience I had had in hospital has been ok. The staff are generally lovely and they communicate well but a nurse confused me for another patient and put in a cannula even though I didn't need it. I have had a good experience on the ward apart from this. The food isn't nice and the water I have to drink is always warm which is unpleasant. I had to wait for hours in A+E when I first come in and I had nowhere to sleep so I wasn't very comfortable. They also used old records from 4 years ago which meant I got given the wrong medication but they did apologise for this. I felt safe in hospital and like being able to get a visitor every 2 days.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: An excellent service
body:
This was the first time we experienced being nursed at home by the ACAH team- very professional and gave great care and attention over the few days they attended.  
Nothing was too much trouble and they were very helpful and respectful. We were kept informed of everything that was happening.  
Their humorous and pleasant demeaner ensured the patient felt at ease and was extremely satisfied with all of the teams professional care and attention,  
This is an excellent service and should be available throughout the province- we highly recommend this team and the service they provide.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: eaglekp75
title: Poor communication
body: The staff have all been great during my time here. I am as comfortable as I can be and the only thing that could be different is that I am never aware of what's happening until it happens so the communication between staff and myself could be better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: caringfx55
title: Poor use of language, not remembering things correctly
body:
I experienced a medical incident many years ago, which left me with acute anxiety, appalling short term effects and basically made my life hell. Nearly ten years later my anxiety kicks in whenever I deal with the NHS.  
I had my appendix removed last year, it went fine apart from scar tissue tearing a few months later, which rather wrecked a job interview.I got a letter telling me it was all fine and I felt better, however the next day I got another letter telling me I'd been referred to Urology as I had a kidney stone, anxiety kicks in as I knew nothing about this. I have had a stone before lets just say it didn't quite go to plan.I attended one interview with a Urologist, a flow test, a call trying to make an appointment and a phone consultation. Each of these caused an anxiety response.  
I've ensured I made each of them aware of my situation and they appear to listen but just carry on anyway. The first letter from the interview, when they told me they wanted to remove the kidney (I did not agreed to this), they told me the remaining kidney appeared to be working. I challenged this as the poor use of language when I spoke to them and they responded quickly with 94%. Why didn't it say that in the letter instead of causing concern?  
I received a letter after my phone consultation that states they wanted a face to face meeting but due to Covid concerns it was done by phone. This is completely wrong. I said I had no issues with Covid, I do have an issue driving for an hour or more having an anxiety attack just to talk to someone.  
It also states: Anxiety related to some previous hospital related management at another hospital. As I clearly stated that wasn't the case and what actually happened, I feel they're not really listening to me. I have little if any confidence in the NHS as it is but these little things just make it worse.  
In my experience I don't think the NHS deals with the problems they create, certainly not great at dealing with anxiety. Yes I could go to a GP but that would involve an anxiety attack.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: allcolours497
title: I actually started to feel worse
body:
I went to A&E as I had sliced two of my fingers.  
On arrival at the Reception area, myself and a friend who had driven me, were informed in a rude manner to "wait behind the sign". A few moments later the patient at the counter moved away. Due to the barrier, I don't think we heard the Receptionist call, as they were then unpleasant and made a sarcastic comment to a colleague when we arrived at the desk.  
I was called through to the nurse who I would not describe as at all compassionate. They informed me I had got myself worked up, that it wasn't that bad and clearly could not understand that not everyone can deal with looking at blood or an open wound.  
Due to my injury and this awful manner, I actually started to feel worse and became visibly upset. At this point, I think they may have realised that the 'bedside manner' was clearly lacking.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: scorpiushw87
title: Generally a good experience
body: I have had a generally good experience in A+E. The staff go out of their way to help you but a staff member in admissions was very tense and had an attitude. I didn't find this to be very patient-centered. I was sitting about with very little information being given to me but I appreciate that is a busy environment and the nurses are doing their very best.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sunsm87
title: Covid/Flu booster experience
body:
Pleased to be called for the vaccines so promptly.  
Disappointed that at 79 I was expected to walk streets in the centre of Dunfermline in the dark on my own.  
Disappointed I had to queue for my appointment for 40 minutes before I even got the chance to sit down and wait a further 20 minutes to be vaccinated.  
Very pleased with the efficiency professionalism and politeness of the staff when I finally was called to be vaccinated.

readBy.name: NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: authenticdf54
title: Lovely staff
body: I arrived to A+E 5 hours ago, but I don't feel I have had to wait too long yet. All my interactions with staff have been good and I have no real complaints. The staff in resus were all lovely.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent flu jab service
body: I attended the practice for a late notice flu jab and I was very impressed with the organisation and friendly attitude of the two people running it.

title: Great experience with booster jab
body: I checked to see if Park Royal vaccination centre was offering booster jabs on a walk in basis. I sent an email to inquire and received a response within 90 minutes inviting me to come by that afternoon. I arrived to find an extremely efficient operation. From when I entered the centre it took just 12 minutes to get my jab and leave, including the 5 minutes post-jab wait time. The nurse who administered my jab as kind, friendly and professional and all the support staff were extremely polite and helpful. I was most impressed, and very grateful.

title: Efficient health response
body: After visiting the chemist for advice, I was advised to contact my GP surgery. After calling,  I was able to explain to the receptionist the concern and recommendation of the chemist. The receptionist sent a link to be able to upload photos and summarise for the doctors attention immediately. This is such an effective and efficient way to seek a GP consult for all concerned with regards to my health need.

title: Real Life Heroes
body:
I cannot thank the entire team enough, from the call handler, the paramedics, nurses and doctors. You all treat our baby boy with the upmost care and professionalism. 

Thanks to you he is safe and well. 

His mother and I were clearly traumatised and it just be so difficult for you to see this night after night. 

You are all amazing and pray you are rewarded in life for all that you too. 

Thank you everybody at the NHS and in this instance the amazing staff at Sunderland Royal Hospital.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Today had covid booster jab. The practice was very well organised and felt covid safe.Staff very professional. Dr was very knowledgeable in what extra vaccines we needed.can highly recommended.

title: Amazing Place - well run and great staff
body: Fast appointment times, friendly and efficient staff and really well run. Good location and although busy its well run and plenty of space

title: Excellent vaccination programmes
body: I attended the surgery for a Covid booster vaccination. The surgery was well organised, quick and efficient.

title: Very impressive surgical experience
body: After a  visit to A&E on Monday, 11 October with a broken elbow, I attended the hospital again 18th for orthopaedic surgery. The facilities were excellent and staff very helpful. The surgical team clearly communicated what was going to happen at each stage. I felt I was in safe hands from the very start. All was successful, and I returned to the  fracture clinic a week later where the surgical dressing was removed and the wound examined. All good! And in such a short time. Thank you all again NHS.

readBy.name: Salisbury NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Wiltshire

title: Brilliant service, brilliant ‘customer’ service
body:
I have had cataracts removed in both eyes here and I can’t fault their ‘service’.  They are kind, caring and make every visit very comfortable.  Each staff member is welcoming and reassuring if you are nervous and very professional and knowledgable when asked a question.
I can’t recommend them enough.  I have recommended them already!!!
More services from the NHS should be like this!!!

author: SSMITH21
title: Very kindly treated
body:
Assessment of my illness in Direct Access Clinic, Daisy Hill Hospital. X rays, CT scans, blood and sputum monitoring, synacthen test, consultations with various doctors, prescription of medications.  
Echocardiogram and O-G-D and overall review still to come.  
Very kindly treated by reception, nurses and doctors.  
A little puzzled as to who was directing the diverse operations.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: great practice
body: i am writing to your overall general manager with praise, tempered by some suggested improvements. i cannot think of anything else to say

author: microscopiumee64
title: Everything was spot on
body: Everything was spot on. I had great interactions with the staff. It was a very quick service and good experience over all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Exceptional!
body: I attended for my flu jab at the surgery. Staff were polite, attentive, efficient and professional. I have nothing but gratitude and respect for the care I always receive at this surgery, thank you all 🙏.

title: Great Practice
body: Whether face to fae, e consult or telephone consultation I have been helped and supported by the practice staff 100 %. I like to free up time for the practice by using e consult however I know that I will be offered an appointment should I need one

author: attendantgw98
title: Thankyou to wonderful staff
body:
Thankyou to wonderful staff in ward 3E, 3F. Sounds mad I have never laughed so much especially with Alex and Lyn so much felt there really go out there way to make patients happy nursing staff all cleaning staff very supportive and kind! even got hugs from Ruby and Kaili so kind and thankyou doctor Rabi for everything,  
keep safe  
godblessKkaren and Rowri and all staff.  
thank you nurses Lynsey and Lara

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
NHS Ayrshire & Arran

title: Flu Jab
body: Got my text to come in for flu jab.  Was very well organised and all staff were very friendly and professional.  In and out in just a few minutes.  Thank you.

title: Great Practice - Very effective medics
body: Every time I’m due to see a doctor or have a consultation, they never fail to attend to me or find the best solution for every medical problem. Very proactive with annual checks and immunisations. I cannot recommend them enough if you’re in their catchment area! Thank you! You’re doing an amazing job!

title: Excellent flu jab
body: Just wanted to thank all at the Family Practice for running flu jab sessions over the weekend.  I went on Saturday and they were their customary cheery and highly efficient selves.  It is much appreciated

title: Excellent caring staff
body: My son took a tumble at school; after convincing him that hospitals are not nasty places we visited L&D A&E. He very quickly discovered that he had nothing to worry about. From start to finish everyone that we encountered in the hospital were lovely and caring, making my son feel reassured from the off. Many thanks to everyone for their incredible work!

title: Amazing receptionist
body: I attended the surgery today (25/10/21) for a physio appointment. Whilst in the waiting room, I witnessed the receptionist being bombarded with angry telephone calls and patients arriving at the surgery after not being able to get through on the phone. I watched your receptionist stay calm, professional and reassuring despite being verbally manipulated and abused by patients. She is amazing at her job, and deserves recognition for her hard work after what I witnessed today.

author: vulpeculade48
title: No longer in a position to work
body:
I was in hospital for a year of my life, I don't think I needed to be in hospital as long as I was.  
While I was in hospital, I lost both my jobs waiting for operations on my knee. Now, I cannot work, I'm basically left to my own devices. I found something to do, working for a local non profit organisation, but that's only 2 days a week.  
I have been going to the gym and doing physio through the rehab team, but I'm only allowed 10-12 visits, and now they are trying to get me onto a private gym.  
I'm 59 years old, and in the last two years I've gone from being in a position where I was working 70 hour weeks, to feeling like I've been dumped on the scrapheap with nothing to do. Its obvious that there's nothing they could do about me needing the operations, but that's a lot of hours in the week to spend - and I'd like to get back to work.  
I have a nurse come in who gives me injections, helps with my medications and my mental health. What the community rehab team (Galashiels) could have done, they could have got me computer literate. I didn't grow up around computers, my family have all their tablets and laptops, but I've never used them, but now I know I am going to have to, especially if I want to find work. If the team had shown me how to use a computer, I would be in a lot better position to get back on my feet, to get back into the workforce.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
NHS Borders
NHS Education for Scotland
Scottish Government

title: Kindness and professionalism
body:
After having broken a number of ribs, not feeling great. But right from the attention at A and E through to the Surgical Assessment ward, all the staff really knew what they were about and were very kind and caring. It seemed to be a busy weekend, particularly in A and E, yet all the staff including the porters and cleaners were unfailingly cheerful, sympathetic and efficient. I should like to thank all the staff for helping me through a difficult time and I am pleased to report that I am now feeling much better!

Kind  regards

Robert Davies
Staddle Stones
Priston
Bath

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Good practice in action
body:
I have been registered at the practice for two years and have encountered three unexpected health problems.

On all occasions, they have been dealt with swiftly and professionally and I have been referred appropriately (on one occasion I was seen at the hospital within a week having submitted my query by eConsult ).

Interestingly all my queries have been entirely appropriately managed via eConsult or via telephone but I have no doubt that a face-to-face appointment would have been made if appropriate.

I have also found the reception staff polite and helpful.

In summary, I have received excellent service from the practice and likwise other members of my family.

title: Excellent service from reception staff
body: Had to ring to sort out some issues for my 90 year old mum to do with her stomer the person who took my call was efficient professional but also very helpful quickly getting a resolution to our situation and clarifying the confusion we had. Thank you

author: avocetwn33
title: Very nice nurses
body: Over the days I've been here I have had very good care. I think the nurses have all been very nice. Sometimes it can be hard to know what's going on with my care until it's happening. I think the food is lovely and I have been very comfortable during my time here. If I ever need anything or ask for anything it is with me very quickly.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: irregularitytc57
title: Quickly made me feel at ease
body: I visited the clinic in October. Not realising it was appointment only, I was hopeful of seeing someone to resolve my issue. I was greeted by two lovely ladies on Reception, who quickly made me feel as ease at being in a Sexual Health Clinic. A young lady with long blonde hair sat with me and helped me complete the form, reassuring me that I was going to be ok and offered me a glass of water. I was really grateful as it put my mind at ease. I waited a short amount of time to be seen, and the service I received was brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: volansej44
title: Very friendly and relaxed
body: I got a check over as thought had something. Came in got checked had a phone consultation came in the next day waiting time was spot on got seen very friendly and relaxed and very accurate also

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: PaulR78
title: Knee surgery
body: Had a knee op, came in at 8am, Lynn who took me to my daybed, Nikki that was in to take my details, Simon the anesthetic nurse to Karen the charge nurse, and t 2 student nurses were awesome, well looked after, a credit to the NHS, not for getting the auxiliary that had to come to the ward after some had been sick, I thank you all.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath
NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Endoscopy Day Ward South Tyneside Hospital
body: Having attended the ward last week I would like to thank you all for the care, courteousness and professionalism shown to me. Again a very big thank you.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Hardworking practice
body:
From booking my appointment to visiting the surgery the reception staff were friendly & helpful 
The advanced practitioner was informative & also helpful 
During these unprecedented times l have always found the surgery will do their best to answer queries & try to accommodate our needs

title: good practice
body: I was very impressed with the service and treatment that i received at the wirral clinic.  Also the staff were all so welcoming and I liked the way that all the staff introduced themselves . The whole clinic looked clean and tidy which also impressed me.

title: service
body: on numerous occasions I have tried to make appointments or had a query and hardly ever get a response or a response at any speed (just scary when it's urgent), since the senior doctor and practice manager left, some staff don't do what they say, which ends up in more calls to them trying to find out what is happening, if they just carried out the tasks they say they would, patients would be left a lot happier and it would save lots more calls to the surgery, some of the reception staff are so condescending, I hate having to use the service, although, when you speak to the doctors they are all lovely, helpful and caring, it's just getting to them which is difficult.

title: Wonderful receptionist
body: The receptionist took her time to answer all my questions, she was patient and her explanation was on point. Great customer service

title: Childrens A&E
body: When arriving to the hospital the lady on reception with red hair wasn’t very pleasant and I could here her moaning to the paramedic! the staff in A&E are rushed off there feet and doing an amazing job! the wait is a really long time but they was brilliant! it’s a shame about the receptionist

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: General Review
body: I have experienced heart & lung that coincided with the Covid 19 pandemic. The Hospital managed to perform my heart by-pass during the height of the pandemic. The GP follow up with blood tests and other scans and test have continued to a degree that I find perfectly satisfactory. Most of the contact with the GP is done on-line using modern IT techniques. Actual in-person visits are made for blood test and vaccinations. I am confident that should it be necessary for face to face consultation then that will happen

title: Very helpful, professional and patient staff
body: I thoroughly enjoy visiting my surgery as odd that may seem. The reception staff are always so friendly and really helpful. I've been with the surgery for quiet a while and I've now registered my little girl. The surgery been under such stress through covid and the ask my gp app has been so easy to use and communicate with the staff. I've seen reviews on neighbouring surgeries and they're terrible! I wish all surgeries where like the one I'm with. Always professional and caring. If I do have an issue they're quick to help resolve the issue.

title: Very supportive, efficient and helpful
body: Flu jab run so well - checking in, the process and the nurse doing the jab - all extremely pleasant, friendly and efficient.  Inspires confidence.  If only other NHS services were run as well.  The problems we hear about in the media don't seem to manifest themselves here.  Well done

title: Caring team
body:
The Deeper Care Team looked after my husband until his death and showed great love and respect for us both.  They came at the time we agreed and were always happy with smiles which made such a difference to us both. The care they gave to my husband was gentle and loving.  The difference the Deeper Care team made to us both in the last weeks was so lovely.   We looked forward to them coming 
in and talking to them.   Our only regret is not finding these lovely people earlier.   If only we had known we could have had them at the beginning of his illness.  I highly recommend Deeper Care.

readBy.name: Healthwatch North Yorkshire

title: Total Disregards for my needs
body: Had reason to call 111 late evening as experiencing severe dizziness and could not lay down room swimming. As a severely disabled 76 old living alone with mobility issues it was very frightening. Doctor came and diagnosed Veritgo. Gave medication told me to ring my GP in morning which I did. My symptoms were still severe so he told me to double the dose said I would not have enough medication so could I have more,   told curtly you will only need to take them for three days so you wont need more. By Friday had no tablets left and feeling nauseus and still dizzy rang surgery and spoke to persciption team,  asked why I had left it till late ,explained gp doubled dose and thats why I needed more,  said she would leave perscription at chemist either that night or following morning. Rang chemist after another horredous night on the morning ,   Saturday. no persciption left, now no doctors open My only option was to ring 111 again  Another half hour waiting on phone then another hour and a half for a doctor from out of hours to ring me back. Doctor immediately sent perscription to my chemist.  I had just wasted hours on the phone when other people more needy than me could be in a queue needing urgent attention all because a lady in the perscription team did not do her job.  Shame on you ,it is the likes of you that are giving GP surgeries a bad name.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Excellent customer service
body: I used the e-consult service to request results of a recent test. I immediately had e-mail confirmation re my query.  5 minutes later I had a text from the surgery with my results.  I am very impressed with the service  provided by the surgery, and in my experience the friendliness of the staff.

title: Very bad practice
body: My husband had surgery on Saturday inPaddington hospital,and Sunday we going to Queens hospital for change drained ,husband was no strong for waiting aria,we asking if possible early but some people sad 3h need wait ,this ridiculous ,we try found way about early but any personal didn’t help,and we continue going to home.Need say I’m no happy about emergency department ,try going next time to another hospital

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Just when you thought it couldn't get worse!
body: Went here to pick up blood forms that were left for me. Nothing was ready, some of the reception staff were lack lustre in their approach to helping. Providing no feedback or even checking if the doctor despatched my blood forms. Sat waiting for about 15 minutes then had to go and ask. The one that served me did not say anything in response so I did not know what she was doing. Then she gives me the forms after another 4-5 minutes without telling me anything. The reliance on the Dr DumbQ app is also ridiculous as the people that end up responding are not the doctors in the surgery most of the time. No quality of care here!

title: Very good
body: I came to A+E on October 12th was seen within half an hour Was admitted and stayed 2 nights  I couldn't find fault with anyone that I came in contact with and was very well looked after I was on Ward 6 Thank you

readBy.name: Airedale NHS Foundation Trust

title: End to end services
body:
I arrived at A&E at about 7.30 am.  I was triaged and had an EGC within 20 mminutes of arrival.  Transferred to the Medical Same Day Emergency Care (SDEC) unit.  Was provided with an overview of the unit and the time-scales related to treatment.  Blood tests, xray and seen doctor within 2.5 hours of arrival on the unit.

Extremely professional services with good communications.  End to end coherency of support with time expectations (internal and patient) all met.

readBy.name: Stockport NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very attentive.
body:
I hate Hospitals, and never want to stay in one. That been said it was only my want to be home, and the fact i felt lost and disconnected from my loved ones. 
As for B.R.I itself and its staff, well in one word, attentive. 
In Honesty I was not at all expecting the level of care, respect, the level of attentive care left no room at all, for error. 
The nurses who obviously were busy, could not do enough to make sure your hospital stay was the best it could be. 
The precautions taken left no room for error making sure ur needed medication was correct, that you are the person they should be giving the medication too, they made absolutely sure there could be no mistake, it was your medication, at the right time exactly when it should be given no room for error at all was given. Just the fact u was asked your name and D.O.B, to further confirm it was you, by asking to see your wrist band shows the out standing attentive practice of the Hospital, the food was good also not bad at all, in fact I rather Enjoyed it. 

I will not go into too much detail as to my health condition as to why I neaded hospital treatment what I will say it was a type of infection that was been stuburn, and was not been affected by Oral medication. 
I was given Antibiotics through a U.V drip, which began to take affect after the second round. 
And I would Just like to say a massive thank You to all the staff at BRI, for all their help. Thank You, BRI Staff, Thanks to all the nurses, Thanks to the kitchen staff and to the tea coffee lady, and Last but not least, THANK YOU NHS. 
I will end with this, I am well on my way to full recovery, and that was only made possible By The Staff of BRI, say what ya want about waiting times ect, these guys do an Amaizing Job and they are Busy doing exacty what they should be doing ,giving out standing care to as many people as possible in a given time. 
I am getting better and I am well on way to fully recover I received the health care I neaded, and that is what matters. Again Thank You Guys, Thank You NHS, You have earned my full respect and gratitude, 
THANK YOU 💗. Pp

readBy.name: Healthwatch Bradford

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: The appointments system, as reported by other frustrated users, is worse than abysmal. What's the pont of being registered with this practice in order to never be able to get an appointment?

title: Very bad service
body:
Called surgery to get a appointment for my son whose Asthmatic, No appointments!! the only answer you get what ever time you ring is “no Appointments”the following day as well Theres no appointments  even to talk to the GP no Appointments an Absolute joke for god sake!  he’s Asthmatic  who needs to be seen to 
The only option you have is contacting out of hours where your  given a appointment at 12am 😡

title: Impossible to see a GP
body:
You just can’t get an appointment. Despite being referred by 111. 

Pre Covid you had a slightly better chance, but I never once felt the team cared about their patients. The reception staff are particularly rude, I often wondered what training they had. 
Such a shame, as the practice itself seems like it has had a lot of investment.

title: Interpretation services
body:
I am an interpreter and I was surprised and concerned when at the end of the appointment the patient was asked by the consultant to bring in a family member at the next appointment "to translate for them". The Government advice on the matter is very clear:
Where language is a problem in discussing health matters, NHS England and NHS Scotland guidance stipulate that a professional interpreter should always be offered, rather than using family or friends to interpret. 
Working with professional interpreters will:

ensure accuracy and impartiality of interpreting
minimise legal risk of misinterpretation of important clinical information (for example informed consent to undergo clinical treatments and procedures)
minimise safeguarding risk (for example for victims of human trafficking, where the trafficker may introduce themselves as family member or friend and speak on behalf of the patient)
allow family members and friends to attend appointments and support the patient (emotionally and with decision-making) without the added pressure of needing to interpret
foster trust with the patient

Certainly something that must be looked into by the hospital to make all staff aware that they must provide a qualified interpreter and never ask a patient to bring in a family member or a friend to interpret.

title: Lovely receptionist
body: I just wanted to write to say how wonderful your South African receptionist is, she really is a credit to the practice.  She is always so kind, helpful and caring when you phone and always goes out of her way to help.

title: Disappointing experience
body:
Sadly like some of the other reviewers have mentioned, the service I received for antenatal care here has been disappointing. Issues with lack of follow up post appointment and what feels like disorganisation is unsettling for a first time to be mum.

Having been referred to the Barkantine from the start of my pregnancy, I went along to the initial appointment and left feeling taken care of after being given a time table of up and coming appointments and a name for my midwife.

The following appointments however were lacking. Some appointments that Id been promised, for example the 16 week midwife appointment and the group antenatal classes never transpired to anything despite me calling to chase for information and pre-registering my interest where needed.  

I’d never been given the opportunity to see my midwife and spoken once over the phone for 5 minutes - leaving the feeling of a very impersonal service. 

Had issues with my gestational diabetes test, being told different information beforehand to help me prepare for the test and after being at the practice for around 3 hours to complete the test i left for home. I was then contacted by someone to say that they hadn’t noted me down as even coming in for the test and I’d need to rebook. This experience left me confused and concerned that’s my results would be mixed up for someone else’s or lost. Promised to then receive the results via telephone which I never did receive.

In addition to the confusing interactions and lack of communication, my GP surgery were not informed of my pregnancy. Upon attempting to book my 25 week midwife appointment they were advised that no record of my pregnancy was noted on the system. 

I have now transferred my care to another hospital due to a relocation and feel relieved to be under another trusts care.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Mixed feelings
body: Main doctor has been Fantastic and filled me with confidence. Gives the feel of how doctor surgery’s used to be, easy to get appointments and short wait times even in the current climate. However the last experience I had with one gp has made me wish to never return. He was dismissive and condescending. Did not read up on notes and basically put everything down to mental health even with obvious physical symptoms. Hopefully was a one off but won’t be in a hurry to make another appointment as no longer feel comfortable there.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Bad practice
body: 5 days of calling at 8.00am for an appointment- waiting from number 30, 1 hour later i get through only to find no appointments available they say call back tomorrow. Same thing the next day- i said to the receptionist i cant keep doing this as i am at work and unable to keep using my phone she was very polite and said i could have the last appointment today- gp will call me between 6-7pm. I have had no call so now will have to call them again tomorrow. Its so annoying! How can all the appointments go when u call them as soon as they are open!

title: Excellent staff.
body: So glad I was referred to SpaMedica for cataract surgery.  From the assessment visit onwards they were excellent, ensuring I was kept informed and encouraged to ask questions. All the staff I encountered were caring and helpful.

title: Worst ever surgery in Manchester
body:
The receptionist lie say no appointment left 

When they feel like give you the appointment even tho they said non left 

They say fill in the online form doctor will call you in 24-48 hours when time comes after that the receptionist give you call asking what’s wrong with you 

I didn’t know the receptionist are doctors aswell they shouldn’t be messing people around as patients have under lying health conditions which can result in fatal problems if not diagnosed by a doctor on time 

Worst survey every time have to go through this headache 

I had a letter from nhs asking call gp to book appointment for my son but the receptionist say no appointment left

readBy.name: Healthwatch Tameside

title: Rude Receptionist
body:
I called this Morning and I had to wait almost 20 min just to get through a receptionist. The staff in this GP are damn right rude, no simple manners at all. All appointment all gone within minutes, lack of stuff. I’m so fed up 😡😡
The call back facility doesn't work either, I had requested twice, and never received a call back.Nobody replies to emails too.

title: Poor service
body:
Phoned at 8:30 to get in the queue for an appointment, had to sit through a 2-3min long automated message so by the time I got to the option to book an appointment the queue was full. 
This has happened on multiple occasions
Please move this automated message so patients hear it while they’re in the queue. 
If someone is calling at 8:30 they clearly urgently need an appointment, having to listen to this long winded message and then be told the queue is full is extremely frustrating and only adds to a person’s anxiety.
Please please rethink this phone system

title: Terrible gp provider
body: Doctors don’t even see patients. Medical examination is vitally important and lacking. Leaving patients vulnerable.

title: Pharmacy good service
body:
Went to collect my medicine, didnt take too long.
Staff smiled.
Thank you.
Travel distance is reasonable, i felt safe.

title: Operation cancelled twice and they say I…
body: Had 2 operation booked  and after sorting time off work twice and messing them about and 1 week b4 they r due to operate I get told I’ve cancelled them,when I have not.if it was not for me phoning to chase up my COVID test I would have not b any wiser

title: Cataract removal
body:
The procedure was carried out in a professional manner with no problems The whole of the staff were thoroughly friendly and professional I was made to feel at ease at all times 
Thank you Christine Tivey

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Poor service
body: We do not get the appointments and have to wait in the queue for long time and then call get disconnected. Emergency doctors are not confident

title: Poor Appointment System
body:
In pre-Covid days, when we made an appointment, we were given a time, and yes it sometimes slipped a bit due to additional time taken with some patients.
Now we ring and are told someone will call back 'today', but no time is given. I appreciate that with mobile phones, calls can physically be taken almost anytime. However, I'm not sure I want to be discussing private health matters in the middle of the supermarket! This means effectively we are trapped at home all day until the call comes.
I appreciate that the NHS is under pressure due to Covid pressures, but don't surgery reception staff know what cover they have available each day when appointment requests are made? How is this different from before? Can't they give a time, even if it's a window, say "probably between 2 and 3PM"?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Healthwatch Bradford

title: Poor service
body: Very poor service. It takes forever for your call to be connected and when it does, you have to hold for an hour to speak to an operator. On one occasion I was number one in the call queue and still has to wait 20 minutes before someone answered.

title: Poor Service
body: When we are advise to be climate friendly, I am being asked to drive 10 miles to drop a letter asking them to do something that can be done via a telephone call. Worse the GP won’t even see me in person. I don’t know how they were rated good by CQC when one can’t find simple complaints forms or procedures. eConsult it’s worse than bolt as it’s only about what they want not what you want.

title: Excellent service
body: I had my first cervical screening appt and I was a bundle of nerves and the nurse was really lovely, patient and informative. I really felt at ease when she explained the procedure. She also went above and beyond along with other enquiries and concerns that I had! The structure of the surgery building since covid as been secure and reassuring with their one way system, use of masks, and social distancing.

title: Efficacious Practice
body:
I attended for my flu vaccination on last Saturday of Sept. As previous, everything was very professional, efficient, fast and very safely administered. 
Thanks as usual to  all the staff of this very well run  GP Practice.

title: Still waiting for a callback
body:
Rang 111  at 12.30pm on behalf of my mother.
She has had a rash for about 1 week, very itchy.
Spoke with adviser, answered assessment questions. Told would receive a callback, not told how long to wait. Still waiting at 19.24pm!!!!!
I now understand why A&E departments are so busy!!!

title: Great Practice
body:
I had a right hip replacement on 21 October and I’m now following the Enhanced Recovery Programme.

From my first appointment I found the staff attentive, and was so relieved  that I had been accepted for treatment following years of agonising OA pain and deterioration of mobility.

Every appointment I attended from seeing the consultant, attending the Pre-Op with the nursing team and seeing the anaesthesist, was a very positive experience, feeling well guided with their informative advice and professionalism.

On the day of surgery I can truly say how well I was looked after from admission to discharge. Thank you too for the kindness shown during my stay on 
Kingfisher Ward. A great team of nurses and supporting staff.  The consultant and anaesthesist also introduced themselves on the day of my surgery which demonstrated how they wanted me to feel comfortable with the procedure. 

Overall, I haven’t got enough words to say how well I was looked after and would like to say a huge thank you to everyone. A diamond in the middle of Ilford, with an amazing group of clinicians. I will definitely be recommending the Practice Plus Group Hospital to everyone I know.

title: Terribly rude
body: Have been attending this surgery for 10 years for the most part its be OK. The past 4 years the receptionists have lost all telephone manners and are damn right rude and unhelpful at times. They lack communication, while implementing a 2 week system for taking bookings over lock down they were telling me this was still in place until today when I was made to feel it was my own fault for missing a hormone injection even though I've been ringing for 3 weeks and either can't get through (they're waiting on an engineer to fix phone lines) or am being told there's no availability. They can't explain what to expect as I've been on this hormone injection for 15years and have worries about coming off it through lack of availability. And for the past 5 years the Dr's have been brushing my symptoms of endometriosis away as IBS even though the symptoms don't match up.I have just registered with another practice, one where the receptionist was more than happy to talk to me and offered helpful suggestions instead of telling me to go all the way to Weymouth to book in at a sexual health clinic. Well done queen's avenue you work with people maybe try having personable people answering the phones, having applied for the receptionist role in the past I know you don't work exhaustive hours it's not tough to be nice for the small amount of time you are there.

readBy.name: Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
